שחורה: feminine singular indefinite form of שחור / שָׁחֹר (shakhór)
שחיטה: slaughter, butchery (the killing of animals, generally for food)
שחיין: A (male) swimmer: a (male) person who swims, especially one who participates in swimming competitions.
שחרור: Release, a release, an act of releasing.
שיכול: transposition, placing crosswise, crossing one's limbs
שינוי: A change (the process of becoming different).
שיראז: Shiraz (a variety of black grape used to make wine)
שכונה: A neighborhood: a residential area, a group of homes in geographic proximity.
שכונת: singular construct state form of שְׁכוּנָה (sh'khuná)
שכנתה: singular form of שְׁכֵנָה (shkhená) with third-person feminine singular personal pronoun as possessor: her neighbor.
שלבים: plural indefinite form of שְׁלָב / שָׁלָב
שלחני: singular form of שולחן / שֻׁלְחָן (shulchán) with first-person singular personal pronoun as possessor, defective spelling: my table.
שליחה: Sending: the action of sending (someone or something).
שמואל: Samuel (the primary author and central character of the first book of Samuel)
שמיכה: blanket (a heavy, loosely woven fabric, usually large and woollen, used for warmth while sleeping or resting)
שמירת: singular construct state form of שמירה (sh'mirá)
שממית: The meaning of this term is uncertain. Possibilities include
שמעון: a male given name, Shimon, equivalent to English Simon
שמעתי: First-person singular past (suffix conjugation) of שָׁמַע (shamá)
שמרטף: babysitter; a (male) person who takes care of one or more infants or children
שמרים: yeast (froth used in medicine, baking and brewing)
שמרנו: First-person plural past (suffix conjugation) of שָׁמַר (shamár)
שמרתי: First-person singular past (suffix conjugation) of שמר (shamár).
שמשון: a male given name, Shimshon, equivalent to English Samson
שניות: plural indefinite form of שנייה / שְׁנִיָּה (sh'niyá)
שנייה: A second: a short period of time, one-sixtieth of a minute.
שריקת: singular construct state form of שְׁרִיקָה (sh'riká)
שרירי: plural construct state form of שריר (sh'rir)
שרפרף: stool (a seat, especially for one person and without armrests)
שרשור: Concatenation, threading: putting multiple units one after another in a continuous sequence.
תבאנה: second-person feminine plural future (prefix conjugation) of בָּא (ba)
תבריז: Tabriz (a city in Iran, the seat of Tabriz County's Central District and the capital of East Azerbaijan Province)
תדמור: Tadmor, a town built by Solomon after his conquest of Hamath-zobah.
תהליך: process (a series of events leading to a result or product)
תוניס: Tunis (the capital city, since 1159, and largest city of Tunisia)
תופים: plural indefinite form of תוף / תֹּף (tof): drums
תוצאה: A result, an outcome, an effect
תזכיר: second-person masculine singular future (prefix conjugation) of הזכיר (hizkir)
תחזית: A prediction or projection, such as a weather forecast, a medical prognosis, or similar.
תחיון: second-person masculine plural future of חִיָּה
תיכנת: to program (a computer, a VCR, etc.)
תיסגר: Second-person masculine singular future (prefix conjugation) of נסגר (nisgár).
תלונה: A complaint: a grievance, an act of complaining.
תליום: thallium (a metallic chemical element (symbol Tl) with atomic number 81: a gray post-transition metal that discolors when exposed to air)
תמנון: octopus (any of several marine molluscs of the order Octopoda, having no internal or external protective shell or bone (unlike the nautilus, squid and cuttlefish) and eight arms each covered with suckers)
תמריץ: An incentive: a source of motivation or encouragement, such as the promise of a financial reward.
תנוחה: A posture, a position (of the body), such as sitting or standing, or such as a sexual position.
תנשמת: barn owl, the bird Tyto alba
תעביר: Second-person masculine singular future (prefix conjugation) of העביר (he'evír)
תעברי: second-person feminine singular future of עבר (avár)
תענית: A fast: abstention from food and drink for a certain time, as an expression of grief or as a part of repentance.
תעשון: Second-person masculine plural future (prefix conjugation) of עָשָׂה (asá).
תפוחי: plural construct state form of תַּפּוּחַ (tapúakh): (the) apples of
תפריט: A menu: a listing of the foods available in a restaurant.
תקדים: A precedent: a past act which may be used as an example for future acts.
תקופת: singular construct state form of תְּקוּפָה (t'kufá).
תקיעה: blast (such as of a horn or trumpet)
תקיפה: An assault, a battery: a violent attack, either literal or figurative.
תרגום: translation (the result of an act of translating)
תרגמה: Third-person feminine singular past (suffix conjugation) of תרגם (tirgém).
תשדיר: a short televised or radio presentation, such as commercial, public service announcement, filler, interlude and the like.
תשובת: singular construct state form of תְּשׁוּבָה (t'shuvá).
תשליך: Second-person masculine singular future (prefix conjugation) of הִשְׁלִיךְ (hishlích).
תשלים: Second-person masculine singular future (prefix conjugation) of הִשְׁלִים (hishlím)
תתפשט: second-person masculine singular future (prefix conjugation) of התפשט (hitpashet)
תתקדם: Second-person masculine singular future (prefix conjugation) of הִתְקַדֵּם (hitkadém).
